intro: Thrincoma alta, commonly known as the highland thrincoma, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, temperate climates with well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. Thrincoma alta is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
